availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Isaac R. H. Caldwell (Hart County, Kentucky, clerk and soldier)

body.p: Hart County, Kentucky, clerk and soldier. Green County, Kentucky, native. Son of Elizabeth Caldwell. Resident of Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Clerk in Hart County in 1860. Household owned eight enslaved persons in Hart County in 1860. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a captain and adjutant from December 31, 1861 to March 4, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 1, p. 107B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, District 1, p. 772.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, District 1, p. 133A.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0263.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 865.
"Isaac Robert Hodgen Caldwell (1839-1900)," Find A Grave, Memorial 116236998, accessed December 14, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/116236998.
